cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue west today, then turn WNW across the northern Caribbean toward the Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and ultimately toward the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Guadeloupe, the north coast of the Dominican Republic & Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and the southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the northern Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Greater Antilles, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and eventually the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) have a 24 % chance of affecting the port late this weekend; brief gusts to near hurricane force cannot be ruled out if the track shifts north.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the hurricane tracks up Florida’s east coast, a surge of 3–5 ft above normal tides would be possible in the Canaveral vicinity; confidence remains low at this lead time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 4–6 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, producing ponding on terminals and possible brief flooding of low-lying access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and long-period swells beginning late week; possible port-channel shoaling and mooring-line strain from wave action.
